articles.title: Moving turtle eggs to protect them disrupts their brain development
articles.description: Moving sea turtle eggs to protect them comes with its own risks, as the resulting hatchlings tend to be less well-developed than those that remain in their original location
articles.content:

articles.title: Penguins adapt their accents to sound more like their friends
articles.description: African penguins modify their calls to sound more similar to their partners and colony mates over time, showing a form of vocal learning known in only a few animals
